alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 7:05PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: A developing tropical system, known as Invest 93W from the Joint Typhoon Warning Center, is currently located west of Saipan. This system continues to slowly get more organized. A southwesterly monsoon flow is strengthening, with the strongest winds located just south of Guam. As 93W continues to slowly strengthen over the coming days and drifts northwest, the monsoon flow will lift northward to encompass all of the Marianas, with sustained southwesterly winds increasing. Timing: Through Wednesday evening Location: All of the Mariana Islands Rainfall: 4 to 8 inches with locally higher amounts possible Land: Sustained winds of 10 to 20 mph, with gusts to 25 mph tonight will increase into the 15 to 25 mph range with gusts to 35 mph developing in the Monday afternoon through Tuesday night time frame, especially near heavier showers and thunderstorm that develop. Marine: Sustained winds of 10 to 20 knots with gusts to 25 knots tonight will increase into the 15 to 25 knot range with gusts to 35 knots possible in the Monday through Tuesday night time frame. Seas of 7 to 10 feet for the Guam and Rota coastal waters will spread north into Tinian`s and Saipan`s coastal waters by Sunday afternoon. Seas will then peak Tuesday into Wednesday in the 10 to 14 foot range, highest in the western coastal waters. Surf of 7 to 10 feet tonight will build into the 9 to 12 foot range for south and west facing reefs, possibly reaching a peak of 13 feet. Impacts: Periods of urban or flash flooding possible. Minor coastal beach erosion is also possible, with hazardous marine conditions developing.
